intro: Chotekia sericea, commonly known as the silky chotekia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely haired stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in open grasslands or rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
